meanings.sent1: His pigheaded refusal to consider other options led to a lot of arguments.
meanings.sent2: She can be quite pigheaded when she has made up her mind about something.
meanings.sent3: Even the pigheaded mule eventually gave in and followed the trail.
meanings.sent4: The pigheaded rock stood unmoved against the relentless waves.
meanings.sent5: The pigheaded child insisted on wearing shorts in the snow, refusing to listen to reason.

meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, his pigheaded determination kept him going.
meanings.sent2: Her pigheaded focus on her goal helped her achieve success against all odds.
meanings.sent3: The pigheaded squirrel refused to leave the bird feeder, no matter what.
meanings.sent4: The pigheaded tree stubbornly held onto its leaves long after all others had fallen.
meanings.sent5: The pigheaded detective wouldn't rest until he solved the case, no matter what obstacles came his way.

meanings.definition: Having a closed mind or refusing to listen to others
meanings.sent1: His pigheaded belief in his own superiority made it hard for him to accept feedback.
meanings.sent2: She was so pigheaded that she never even considered the possibility of being wrong.
meanings.sent3: The pigheaded customer insisted on speaking to the manager, even though the issue was easily resolved.
meanings.sent4: The pigheaded politician refused to acknowledge the concerns of the people, leading to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: The pigheaded professor dismissed any new ideas that challenged his established theories.
